Key Match Events: Spencer Horwitz homered twice among his four hits
José Berríos pitched six effective innings and allowed one earned run and five hits to set a career-high for wins
Ernie Clement and Joey Loperfido had back-to-back RBI doubles
Will Wagner's grounder to make it 6-0 in the fifth
Nathan Lukes' RBI single, Vladimir Guerrero Jr.'s run-scoring fielder's choice and Wagner's RBI single extended Toronto's advantage to 9-1
Jarred Kelenic had an RBI single, Orlando Arcia's single to centre and Luke Williams followed with a two-run double to cut the deficit to 9-4
Pre-Game Insights: Braves manager Brian Snitker acknowledged the need to focus on winning each game moving forward
Post-Match Reflections: Braves fell one game behind the Mets with New York's 4-0 win over Cincinnati
Braves' Spencer Schwellenbach's worst outing in his last 11 starts
Braves fell to 7-37 this season in games they've allowed five runs or more
Miscellaneous Highlights: Spencer Horwitz had his second career multihomer game
The Blue Jays extended their advantage to 9-1 with three runs in the top of the ninth
